intro: Pedicularis taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces strikingly colorful, spurred flowers that range from red to yellow, often resembling those of orchids. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
